The Company will have the right to limit promotional incentives offered through the Spoken-Word Audio Section based on traffic volume, if such volume poses a commercially untenable position for the Company as determined solely by the Company. Unless otherwise agreed in writing, the Company will be solely responsible for all pricing, delivery, and fulfillment of products (including Spoken-Word Audio Products) offered through the Spoken-Word Audio Section (including the Mirror Company Site).

2.3 The Responsible Party shall not be obligated to undertake any actions beyond the scope of their customary duties and responsibilities as defined in this Agreement, unless expressly requested in writing by the other party and such request is explicitly accepted by the Responsible Party in writing.

In essence, this clause implies that while the Responsible Party does have certain obligations, they are not bound to go beyond their normal duties without explicit written instruction from the other party and their own acceptance of such request in writing. This provides a level of protection for the Responsible Party against being overburdened with tasks outside of their typical remit.

modified:
Section 6.  Proprietary Rights 6.1   Shared Usage and Limitation of Liability.

In this revised section, the focus shifts from ownership to shared usage, implying that both parties have some rights to use the proprietary information, but neither party assumes full ownership. Additionally, a limitation of liability is introduced, suggesting that neither party will be held responsible for any damages arising from the use or misuse of the shared proprietary information. This revised clause aims to protect both parties while promoting collaboration and sharing of resources. However, it is essential to note that this is a simplified example, and specific terms should be agreed upon between the parties in a legally binding contract.

original: 6.1.4  To the extent that any Joint Works are created in the course of performance of this Agreement, each Party shall own a joint, equal and undivided ownership interest in and to such Joint Works and the associated Intellectual Property Rights, with no duty on the part of either Party to account to the other with respect to its use and exploitation of the same. Each Party retains exclusive ownership of any Derivative Works developed from the Joint Works by or for them, as well as the Intellectual Property Rights associated with those Derivative Works (except in cases where such rights are also connected to the Joint Works). It's important to note that either Party is not bound by any obligation to share profits, royalties, or any other financial remuneration stemming from these Derivative Works with the other.

original: 7.2  Indemnity.  Each Party (as applicable, the "Indemnifying Party") will defend, indemnify and hold harmless the other Party (the "Indemnified Party") and its Affiliates (and their respective employees, directors and representatives) from and against any and all claims, costs, losses, damages, judgments and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of any Claim, to the extent it is based on (a) the operation or content of the Indemnifying Party's Site (other than any items or materials supplied, or operation or content required, by the Indemnified Party), (b) the offer, marketing or sale of any products or services through the Indemnifying Party's Site (other than any products offered, marketed or sold by the Indemnified Party Source: AUDIBLE INC, 10-Q, 11/13/2000 through such Site, the Parties acknowledging that Company shall be deemed the Indemnifying Party as to any Claim related to any products offered, marketed or sold by Company through the Spoken-Word Audio Sub-Section  and/or Mirror Company Site, except to the extent that such Claim relates to any ACSI Site Functionality or other items or content provided by or for ACSI with respect to the Spoken-Word Audio Sub-Section  and/or Mirror Company Site ), (c) any actual or alleged breach of the Indemnifying Party's representations or warranties set forth in Section 7.1   [Representations]  above, or, in the case of Company, its obligations under Section 4.4   [Regulatory Compliance]   above, or (d) any actual or alleged infringement of any Intellectual Property Rights by any content, items or materials provided by the Indemnifying Party to the Indemnified Party for its use under this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
7.2 Indemnity and Limitation. In the event that a dispute (hereinafter, "Claim") arises, each Party (referred to as the "Responsible Party" in reference to the specific Claim) shall be responsible only for the portion of the Claim attributable to their respective obligations under this Agreement. The Responsible Party will offer reasonable efforts to mitigate, settle, and defend against the Claim, indemnifying and holding harmless the other Party (the "Affected Party") and its Affiliates (alongside their respective employees, directors, and representatives) from any and all damages, losses, costs, expenses, or judgments incurred as a result of such Claim. This indemnification obligation applies to Claims primarily based on:

(a) the management or content of the Responsible Party's platform (excluding any items or materials required by the Affected Party),
(b) the offering, marketing, or selling of products or services through the Responsible Party's platform (except for those provided by the Affected Party),
(c) any breach of the Responsible Party's agreements or warranties set forth in Section 7.1 [Representations] above, and
(d) any infringement of Intellectual Property Rights by content, items, or materials supplied by the Responsible Party to the Affected Party for use under this Agreement; provided that the Affected Party shall assume responsibility for any Claims related to products offered, marketed, or sold by the Affected Party on such platform. The Affected Party is solely liable for complying with all applicable regulations, and the Responsible Party's indemnification obligations do not extend to any breaches of Section 4.4 [Regulatory Compliance] above.

original: 11.4     Nondisclosure. Each Party will protect the Confidential Information of the other Party from misappropriation and unauthorized use or disclosure, and at a minimum, will take precautions at least as great as those taken to protect its own confidential information of a similar nature, but in no event with less than reasonable care. Without limiting the foregoing, the Receiving Party  will: (a) use such Confidential Information  solely for the purposes for which it has been disclosed; and (b) disclose such Confidential Information only to those of its and its Affiliates' employees, agents, and consultants who have a need to know the same for the purpose of performing this Agreement and who are informed of and agree to a duty of nondisclosure. The Receiving Party may also disclose Confidential Information  of the Disclosing Party to the extent necessary to comply with applicable Law or legal process or pursuant to a registration report or exhibits thereto filed or to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, listing agency or any stock securities commission, or any other associated filings, provided that the Receiving Party uses gives the Disclosing Party  not less than ten (10) days' prior written notice thereof and complies with all reasonable requests of the Disclosing Party to minimize the extent or scope of any such disclosure. Upon request of the other Party, or in any event upon any termination or expiration of the Term, each Party shall return to the other or destroy (and certify in writing such destruction) all materials, in any medium, which contain, embody, reflect or Source: AUDIBLE INC, 10-Q, 11/13/2000 reference all or any part of any Confidential Information  of the other Party.
ollama_generated:
11.4 Confidentiality Obligations: Each Party acknowledges and agrees to exercise a level of care in protecting the Confidential Information of the other Party that is comparable to, but not exceeding, the care exercised by each Party in protecting its own confidential information of a similar nature. This duty of confidentiality shall extend to all Confidential Information received from the Disclosing Party and shall be maintained for as long as the Confidential Information remains confidential or until the Confirmation Period expires, whichever is longer.

The Receiving Party shall: (a) utilize the Confidential Information solely for the purposes for which it has been disclosed; (b) restrict access to such Confidential Information to its employees, agents, consultants, and other authorized persons who have a legitimate need to know such information for the performance of this Agreement; (c) ensure that all such individuals are made aware of, and agree in writing to, their obligations under this Clause 11.4; and (d) disclose the Confidential Information only when strictly necessary to comply with applicable law or legal process, or pursuant to a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, listing agency, or any stock securities commission, provided that such disclosure is made in accordance with the minimum requirements of this Clause 11.4 and the Receiving Party gives the Disclosing Party at least ten (10) days' prior written notice thereof and complies with all reasonable requests of the Disclosing Party to minimize the extent or scope of any such disclosure.

Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, or upon request from either Party during the Confirmation Period, each Party shall return all materials in any medium that contain, embody, reflect, or source any Confidential Information of the other Party and provide written certification confirming the destruction of such materials. In the event that a return is not feasible, the Receiving Party shall ensure that the Confidential Information is adequately secured and protected from unauthorized access or disclosure for as long as necessary to comply with applicable law or any contractual obligations between the Parties.

original: 11.7     Assignment. modified: 11.7 Assignment: The assignee hereby grants ACSI the right, at its sole discretion, to assign or delegate this Agreement or any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement, without obtaining prior written consent from Company, except in cases where the assignment is made to a party that is not a wholly owned subsidiary. Such exceptions include assignments in connection with any corporate reorganization aimed at maximizing the tax liability of ACSI and its Affiliates, or other bona fide corporate purposes, as well as transactions involving a Change of Control. This Agreement shall remain binding upon and benefit the Parties hereto and their successors and assigns, except that ACSI may assign this Agreement to (a) any corporation or entity resulting from any merger, consolidation, or other reorganization involving ACSI; (b) any Affiliate of ACSI; or (c) any person or entity to which ACSI transfers all or substantially all of its Confidential Information, provided that the relevant information has been duly disclosed to the Securities and Exchange Commission.

original: 11.13    Entire Agreement.  This Agreement (a) represents the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes any previous or contemporaneous oral or written agreements regarding such subject matter and (b) may be amended or modified only by a written instrument signed by a duly authorized agent of each Party.  No breach of this Agreement by either Party shall affect the rights or obligations of either Party under any other Agreement between the Parties; rather, the same will remain in full force and effect.
ollama_generated:
11.13 Entire Understanding. This Agreement serves as the complete understanding between the Parties concerning the specified subject matter, and supersedes all prior or concurrent oral or written agreements on this topic. Any potential modifications to this Agreement require a written document, authenticated by a duly appointed representative of each Party. It is acknowledged that any breach of this Agreement by either Party shall not impact their obligations or rights under any other agreement between them; instead, such unrelated agreements shall persist in full force and effect.

In this revised clause, the language has been slightly altered to emphasize a greater separation between agreements, indicating that a breach of one will not automatically invalidate the others. The focus is on the independent nature of each agreement and their continued validity despite any issues arising within the scope of this particular Agreement.
